documentation.text: @notice Instantiates an AttestationStation, and an OptimistInviter.
@notice Returns a user's current invite count, as stored in the AttestationStation.
@notice Returns true if claimer has the proper attestation from OptimistInviter to mint.
@notice Get signature as a bytes blob, since SignatureChecker takes arbitrary signature blobs.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,bytes memory,bytes memory,uint256,address) returns (struct OptimistInviter.ClaimableInvite memory,bytes memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Signs a claimable invite with the given private key and returns the signature using
         correct EIP712 domain separator.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct OptimistInviter.ClaimableInvite memory,bytes memory,bytes memory,uint256,address) pure external returns (bytes32)

documentation.text: @notice Commits a signature and claimer address to the OptimistInviter contract.

@notice Issues 3 invites to the given address. Checks that all expected events are emitted
         and that state is updated correctly.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: only invite granter can grant invites"

arguments.value: OptimistInviter: only invite granter can grant invites

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: only invite granter can grant invites"

documentation.text: @notice Bob, who is not the invite granter, should not be able to issue invites.
@notice Sally should be able to commit an invite given by by Bob.
@notice Sally should be able to Bob's for a different claimer, Eve.
@notice Attempting to commit the same hash twice should revert. This prevents griefing.

@notice Bob issues signature, and Sally claims the invite. Bob's invite count should be
         decremented, and Sally should be able to mint.
@notice Bob issues signature, and Ted commits the invite for Sally. Eve claims for Sally.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: minimum commitment period has not elapsed yet"

arguments.value: OptimistInviter: minimum commitment period has not elapsed yet

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: minimum commitment period has not elapsed yet"

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,bytes memory,bytes memory,uint256,address) returns (struct OptimistInviter.ClaimableInvite memory,bytes memory)

documentation.text: @notice Signature issued for previous versions of the contract should fail.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,bytes memory,bytes memory,uint256,address) returns (struct OptimistInviter.ClaimableInvite memory,bytes memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Replay attack for signature issued for contract on different chain (ie. mainnet)
         should fail.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,bytes memory,bytes memory,uint256,address) returns (struct OptimistInviter.ClaimableInvite memory,bytes memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Replay attack for signature issued for instantiation of the OptimistInviter contract
         on a different address should fail.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: nonce has already been used"

arguments.value: OptimistInviter: nonce has already been used

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: nonce has already been used"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: nonce has already been used"

arguments.value: OptimistInviter: nonce has already been used

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: nonce has already been used"

documentation.text: @notice Attempting to claim again using the same signature again should fail.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct OptimistInviter.ClaimableInvite memory) view external returns (bytes32)
literal_string "OptimistInviter: claimer and signature have not been committed yet"

arguments.value: OptimistInviter: claimer and signature have not been committed yet

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "OptimistInviter: claimer and signature have not been committed yet"

documentation.text:
@notice Claimer must commit the signature before claiming the invite. Sally attempts to
         claim the Bob's invite without committing the signature first.
@notice Using a signature that doesn't correspond to the claimable invite should fail.

@notice Attempting to use a signature from a issuer who never was granted invites should
         fail.

@notice Attempting to use a signature from a issuer who has no more invites should fail.
         Bob has 3 invites, but issues 4 invites for Sally, Carol, Ted, and Eve. Only the
         first 3 invites should be claimable. The last claimer, Eve, should not be able to
         claim the invite.
